headline: Pineapple and Banana Smoothie
description: This pineapple smoothie with banana is quick, tropical, fruity goodness with just four ingredients. Easily blend together and your smoothie is served.

video.description: A silky smooth breeze into tropical refreshment.
video.name: Pineapple and Banana Smoothie

name: Pineapple and Banana Smoothie
recipeIngredient: 0.25 fresh pineapple - peeled, cored and cubed

recipeInstructions.text: Place ice cubes, pineapple, banana, and pineapple juice into the container of a blender.

review.reviewBody: really good!, i dont know if this is bad, but i did put some homeade iced foam into it, the two mixed together kind of clash, but the smoothie itself is amazing!!!
Only different thing I did was add coconut water ( my pineapples were already in the jar with it ). Super easy, great taste. Thank You
This is scrumptious! However, it has far too much sugar for my low sugar diet.
Couldn't be any easier! Delish!
This was awesome I will definitely try this again! I had BLTs for dinner and this smoothie it was awesome!
I think this is an ok recipe. I didn't hate it but I didn't think it was super wow. This is good for helping with weight loss if needed.
Very refreshing on a hot, summer day!
It was great! A good way to use up pineapple. very different from the usual strawberry and banana smoothie.
loverly
Delicious! I added a maraschino cherry, just for fun. This is a very large amount for 1 serving, so I would say it easily serves 3 if you like a smallish smoothie, as I do.
Brilliant
Awesome delicious mmmm
Tase yummy
Delicious!
Yummy! I will make this again. No changes.
no changes
My favorite smoothie! Simple, easy, delicious!
Easy and fast. Tips: use frozen fruit or freeze juice into cubes. This works great in the summer. Buy fruit in season and cube and freeze on sheet pan - single layer at a time.

Wow! Delicious as is! However... I added 2 cups of liquid apple juice and some frozen apple juice, some organic raw honey, ground flax seed, and some toasted coconut greek yogurt. Can you say delicious! My son loved it! The only thing missing was sitting on an island on vacation! Thanks for the recipe!
Pretty good
This was delicious. Even my dog wanted some! The banana and pineapple mixture was very tasty. I would indeed make this smoothie again.
I didn't make it changes.It was delicious ,will be making again in the near future.

I love it even though I didn't use apple juice or pineapple juice cause I was all out. 
 C'est tres fantastique.
This is excellent! I added an extra banana for extra flavor and added chia seeds and a bit of protein powder for extra health "power".
Loved it! Very tasty and easy to make!
Very delicious.I loved how quick and easy it was to make.And there was no messy clean up.:)
Delicious
Very healthy smoothie and nutritious. Easy to make.

This was a very simple but healthy and delicious smoothie. I've always frozen my ripe bananas for homemade cake or bread. But now I've already cut them in chunks & placed in the freezer to use for a much healthier smoothie. : )

This was a very simple but healthy and delicious smoothie. I've always frozen my ripe bananas for homemade cake or bread. But now I've already cut them in chunks & placed in the freezer to use for a much healthier smoothie. : )
Really nice. I substituted orange juice for pineapple/apple juice.
This was super good! I didn’t have juice, so I added a cutie orange, some water, and some I’ve cubes. Awesome!
soooo god

I don't use ice cubes unless one of the ingredients is very sweet- I substituted the 4 ice cubes with 4 chunks frozen banana, approximately the same size.
*I always use frozen banana chunks (1") instead of ice when I can; they don't water down the flavor and when they warm up the smoothie retains its thickness because of the fruit. I got the tip from my brother's runner's guide- the basic smoothie recipe suggested the switch and I love it!
*2Tbsp. Honey Crunch wheat germ is the only other ingredient that goes in all of my smoothies. Even though my Ninja Pro pulverized everything before 30 seconds are up, it still adds a subtle crunch to the texture and even though very low in sugar, I still have to reduce the sweetest ingredient accordingly.

These two are my favorite in the Peanut Butter-Banana Smoothie I make.
*will go over changes when I rate that one! Yum!
we did not blend it all the way but it was delish
I made it with frozen pineapple and also added frozen strawberries. A very refreshing drink.

Made it just as suggested great.. then made it with no juice frozen banana frozen fresh pineapple almond milk and protein powder (non soy, non dairy) and scoop of almond ice cream and some almond yogurt.. A meal... now the ice cream was the treat for me.. but even without it filled me up. I leave out the ice cream and still wonderful 
5 stars cause really good as is...
Add coconut milk, thank me later.
Good and easy to make! I used apple juice as that is what I had on hand and will make again!
It was alright, could have been sweeter and texture didn't stay for long. OverAll I'd make it again but with a twist .
Fab, didn't add the icecubes

This is my first review and in no way am I criticizing this recipe, it is very good, this is just my spin on it. My wife works in a grocery store and brings home fresh fruit left over from fruit trays. Yesterday it was pineapple so this is how I did it. I whole pineapple cored and cubed in the blender. Blend this up it will make it's own juice, add a few tablespoons of vanilla yogurt to get it mixing well, throw in a couple of bananas, the riper the better, continue adding yogurt to fill the blender or get the consistency you want. I make a blender full at a time because this is my breakfast every morning so it last a couple of mornings. I usually add oatmeal to all my smoothies for the extra fiber but I did not add to this because it is pretty thick already. Thanks.
Yummy! Though I prefer it with an extra banana.
Blended using my Ninja and it became an instant favorite. Just the right proportion of fruit that pleases all my kids, even the one who doesn't like pineapple! Used Apple juice.

I'm not a big fan of pineapple, but this was a nice, refreshing drink. I was looking for something without milk or yogurt. I had to use canned pineapple. I used a frozen banana, and still added the ice. I only used 1/2 c juice, as I don't like my smoothies too liquidy. It was not very sweet, but that was fine for me today.
Simply Delicious!! I did not have any of the juices recommended. I used plain yogurt and plenty of ice and it was perfect! I did have a freshly cut pineapple which was perfectly ripe. So tasty!
Easy and delicious recipe, used fresh pineapple and organic apple juice. Added just a couple more ice cubes. I will definitely make this again.
Easy and simple to make. The family LOVED it! I added plain organic Greek yogurt and spinach. I will Moshe this again.
Awesome

Not sweet enough for me so I added vanilla ice cream. So many are trying to lose weight that those of us trying to gain weight get overlooked so I've found that adding ice cream to most any of the smoothies helps.
Just added a little Almond milk! Delicious!

This is very refreshing! I used a frozen banana and fresh frozen pineapple. I added a splash of pure vanilla extract and apple juice. I suggest apple juice vs. pineapple because the pineapple is very strong from the fruit that if I added juice it would have been a pineapple overload! I would make this again!
Delicious! Both the boys loved it, and I added a scoop each of chia gel and hemp seeds to boost the nutritional value.
Was refreshing and sweet, but wasn't really special.
Very refreshing and good. will make this again.
I did add low fat vanilla yogurt and flax seed to add a little bulk . Very yummy!
Love this! I used coconut water, because I didn't have apple or pineapple juice. It's delicious and so refreshing.
I added 1 tbl protein powder; 1 tbl flax seed; 1 tbl honey; and used coconut milk. It was great!!
Very yummy! I used the Nutribullet instead of a blender, the apple juice and a frozen banana.
Great recipe! Was very refreshing and tasty. Made a nice snack paired with some trail mix! :)
Great smoothie. I added vanilla yogurt, but it would have been delicious without it too.
This is a very yummy recipe! Instead of using pineapple juice, I used 1 cup of apple juice. I LOVE this smoothie. I am definently making it again!

I really didn't follow the measurements. I just estimated it and placed everything in my Vitamix professional series 7500, dialed it to smoothie blend and the machine did the rest. I really liked the taste! I'll do some more! A very healthy drink!
Delicious a smoothie I can enjoy after a long afternoon of track

This was one delicious smoothie! My banana was frozen so I chose not to add the ice cubes; I think it came out more creamy (as opposed to frosty) by doing that. Like I usually do with smoothies, I also added a few tblsps each of ground flaxseed and vanilla protein powder. Here, I also added 1 tblsp of melted coconut oil. It was also a nice change not adding the usual yogurt. Great tropical tasting smoothie that I know I will make again! Thanks VERITY78!
VERY YUMMY! Next time I'll add extra pineapple juice though...or maybe some orange juice :)

I used crushed ice and one can pineapple chunks with the apple juice and cut up banana and added vanilla yogurt. Good! Not as flavorful as o thought would be. But still nice cool refreshing drink on way to work in the mornings.
I also added celery, raw almonds and a few ice cubes... cut back on the sweetness and get some veggie's in there... kids loved it

Gorgeous! Tropical bliss! I've been on the search for some dairy free recipes and I think I just found a winner. I used a frozen banana and canned pineapple, next time I am going to try adding some mint leaves!
Great and easy recipe. Taste great!
Absolutely perfect!
Surprising good at first try with white grape juice instead of apple juice.
Really refreshing. I changed the recipe by adding a little almond milk, and it was a gloriously creamy result!

My son selected this recipe because we heard Pineapple is a great post-workout fruit to help minimize soreness. Everyone loved it! I couldn't believe with just a few simple ingredients, we could get such a yummy tropical drink. We will definitely be making this throughout the summer!

I LOVED THIS SMOOTHIE! I ADDED 1 PEELED PEACH N 3 TBLS. OF LITE VANILLA PLAIN YOGURT TO IT. THIS WAS DELIOUS! :) THANK YOU FOR SHARING THIS RECIPE. :)

Sincerely,
JAdezeria
Made popsicles and smoothies with recipe. Made as is using fresh squeezed apple juice. Maybe I'll try pineapple juice next time.

I loved this. I had some leftover fresh pineapple and a banana that was starting to turn brown, so this was perfect. Very refreshing, frothy, and just simply delicious. I always throw away leftover pineapple, not anymore. :)
Added Kefir
Very good. I used fresh pineapples and its juice. It wasn't too sweet. my children enjoyed it also. But not a favorite.
1st attempt it was delicious!!!
My boyfriend loved this. I replaced the juice with coconut water and added some ground flax seed and a tablespoon of almond butter to up the healthy fats. It was delicious.
So good! One of my favorite smoothies.

Yum! This is way better than I expected it to be for some reason. I usually have canned pineapple and juice in the cabinets and used that. I used the juice that came with the pineapple and what I didn't have I opened a juice. I always have frozen bananas in the house for smoothies so I used a frozen one. They make for frothier smoothies anyway. The two alone are a great combination together. I got about 2 servings out of mine. Thank you!
Good! Simple! And I added some peanut butter because I like texture.
I made it for work and added a protein shake into it!!!!
quick, easy, like the apple juice base
This was really good. I used canned pineapple, the juice from that and I also added in a handful of spinach, chard, bok choy and kale mix.
not enough pineapple for me, used a full cup, maybe a bit more...
I did not care for this recipe. Found it too cloying.
Great recipe! I love to "ad lib" with recipes, so I added a splash of vanilla, half of a peeled and cored apple, skim milk, and some flax seed. It's an easy recipe to tweak to your taste.
Amazing!! Fresh & delicious! I used pure, homemade apple juice. Five stars doesn't seem like enough!!
i poured this into Popsicle and ice cube molds and the kids loved it!

Two thumbs up! Wanted a recipe that didn't call for yogurt as one child has an allergy to it. This was perfect! Used coconut milk from the dairy case not from the can instead of pineapple juice and threw in a small handful of blueberries. Wonderful!

Banana & pineapple....one of my favorite combinations for smoothies!! I like the fact that yogurt isn't required as I never have any when I want to make a smoothie but it's easy enough to keep a can of pineapple and apple juice in the cupboard & bananas in the freezer. :)
Simple and Delicious
Didn't have fresh pineapple but thought it tasted very good without it.

I usually use vanilla yogurt or frozen yogurt so I was unsure about just using ice. It was really good. I made one, but I had to make another for my teenage daughter after she tasted mine. I did not have either of the juices so I used orange juice instead. Will definitely make again and plan to try with apple or pineapple juice.
Great smoothie. I used a whole apple in place of apple juice and added a bit more ice. It was great.
Very delicious...used fresh pineapple and substituted coconut milk for the juice. Everyone loved it.
